item.title: Positive Prediction for Free Improv
item.author: Matthew Earnshaw,
item.description: “I think free improvisation’s great era is over”, lamented the late Derek Bailey in a 2004 interview with The Wire’s David Keenan. A key figure in the development of the artform, the guitarist was already sounding its death knell, barely more than thirty years since it had become a recognised …

item.title: Jar Moff review
item.author: Matthew Earnshaw,
item.description: Berlin-based record label PAN have a tough act to follow this year given the strength of the line up curated by label owner Bill Kouligas in 2012. Releases such as those from Lee Gamble, Heatsick, and Helm, amongst others, received widespread critical acclaim for their cutting edge visions of …

item.title: London Jazz Festival 2012 Preview
item.author: Matthew Earnshaw,
item.description: Tonight sees the return of the London Jazz Festival. The capital’s largest pan-city festival, this two week affair comprises hundreds of events spanning dozens of venues. Glancing at the range of the bands playing this year reveals that the days of ‘jazz tradition’ are long gone. One would be …
